intro: [WRONG START] Embilia libeniana, commonly known as the Ethiopian starfruit, is a small evergreen shrub native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, white, star-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically green when mature, though they may change color slightly. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in forested areas with high humidity. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and research settings.
